citations.narrative:
The written program of veterinary care is incomplete. There is no specific frequency or number of animals noted for
sampling dogs for intestinal parasites and heartworm. At this time, no dogs are being sampled for heartworm or intestinal
parasites. Intestinal parasites and heartworm are common causes of disease in dogs and, if undetected and not properly
treated, can lead to serious illness. All required information listed in section 3.13(a) must be included in the program of
veterinary care and dogs must be sampled for heartworm and intestinal parasites.
Correct by 1/4/2023.

APHIS Form 7005 indicated a 5 year old Maltese was found dead on 5/23/23. The licensee explained that he observed
that the animal was not eating the day before, so he provided wet food that enticed the animal to eat. He did not have
documentation of the problem and when it was identified. Without proper documentation, it is difficult to determine that the
animal received adequate care. A proper medical record includes the date and a description of the problem, examination
findings, test results, plan for treatment and care, and treatment procedures performed. This must be recorded and a copy
kept for review for inspection by APHIS officials. Correct by ensuring all records of any treatments for problems identified
in the dogs are recorded and maintained at all times.
Correct starting on 12/7/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
KEVIN WILKEN, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The written program of veterinary care is incomplete. There is no specific frequency or number of animals noted for 
sampling dogs for intestinal parasites and heartworm. At this time, no dogs are being sampled for heartworm or intestinal 
parasites. Intestinal parasites and heartworm are common causes of disease in dogs and, if undetected and not properly 
treated, can lead to serious illness. All required information listed in section 3.13(a) must be included in the program of 
veterinary care and dogs must be sampled for heartworm and intestinal parasites.  
Correct by 1/4/2023. 
3.13(b)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
APHIS Form 7005 indicated a 5 year old Maltese was found dead on 5/23/23. The licensee explained that he observed 
that the animal was not eating the day before, so he provided  wet food that enticed the animal to eat. He did not have 
documentation of the problem and when it was identified. Without proper documentation, it is difficult to determine that the 
animal received adequate care. A proper medical record includes the date and a description of the problem, examination 
findings, test results, plan for treatment and care, and treatment procedures performed.  This must be recorded and a copy 
kept for review for inspection by APHIS officials. Correct by ensuring all records of any treatments for problems identified 
in the dogs are recorded and maintained at all times. 
Correct starting on 12/7/2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
KEVIN WILKEN, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR  n
